question_text: What is the primary reason for the introduction of simplified Wi-Fi generation names like Wi-Fi 5 and Wi-Fi 6?
answer_options: To reduce confusion caused by 802.11 naming
correct_answer: To reduce confusion caused by 802.11 naming
explanation: The Wi-Fi Alliance introduced generation names (e.g., Wi-Fi 5, Wi-Fi 6) to make it easier for consumers to understand the relative capabilities of each version.
